de.esoco.storage.impl.jdbc

Class JdbcStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.storage.Storage
        • de.esoco.storage.impl.jdbc.JdbcStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.manage.Releasable, de.esoco.lib.manage.Transactional, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class JdbcStorage
extends Storage
    A storage implementation that uses a JDBC connection to store objects.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Description copied from class: Storage
        Checks whether the storage is still valid for further use. Some implementations may have timeouts or are based on network connections that are closed and can therefore return FALSE in such a case to indicate that a new storage instance must be used.
        Specified by:
        isValid in class Storage
        Returns:
        TRUE if the storage is valid for further storage operations
        See Also:
        Storage.isValid()

      • query

        public <T> Query<T> query(QueryPredicate<T> rQueryPredicate)
                   throws StorageException
        Description copied from class: Storage
        Returns a query for a certain object type and (optional) query criteria. The query is defined with an instance of QueryPredicate which contains the mapping of the objects to be queried as well as the query criteria.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        rQueryPredicate - The predicate that defines the query
        Returns:

        Throws:
        StorageException - If creating the query fails
        See Also:

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws StorageException
        Description copied from class: Storage
        Method from the Transactional interface that performs a rollback of the currently active storage transaction. Only has an effect if the storage implementation supports transactions.

        Attention: This method call affects the storage only, but will not reset any objects from the storage that have been modified by the application.

        Specified by:
        rollback in interface de.esoco.lib.manage.Transactional
        Specified by:
        rollback in class Storage
        Throws:
        StorageException - If the rollback fails
        See Also:
        Storage.rollback()

        Overrides:

        See Also:

      • close

        protected void close()
        Description copied from class: Storage
        Must be implemented to close the storage. This method should normally not throw exceptions, therefore no storage exception is declared. Only a failure that would cause the storage to be left in an inconsistent state should be signaled with a corresponding runtime exception.

        Applications are not supposed to call this method but must use the method Storage.release() instead. The closing of storages is handled internally by the storage manager.

        Specified by:
        close in class Storage
        See Also:
        Storage.close()

      • hasObjectStorage

        See Also:
        Storage.hasObjectStorage(Class)

      • initObjectStorage

        protected void initObjectStorage(StorageMapping<?,?,?> rMapping)
                          throws StorageException
        Implemented to create the database tables for the given mapping. If the mapping contains child-mappings the child tables will also be created. But the tables will only be created if the table for the top-level mapping doesn't exist already.
        Specified by:
        initObjectStorage in class Storage
        Throws:
        StorageException
        See Also:
        Storage.initObjectStorage(StorageMapping)

      • removeObjectStorage

        protected void removeObjectStorage(StorageMapping<?,?,?> rMapping)
                            throws StorageException
        Must be implemented by subclasses to remove the storage data and/or structures for a certain storage mapping. Invocation if no object storage exists should be ignored. If the mapping has subordinate mappings these MUST NOT be removed from the storage, only the designated mapping.
        Specified by:
        removeObjectStorage in class Storage
        Throws:
        StorageException
        See Also:
        Storage.removeObjectStorage(Class)

      • storeObject

        protected void storeObject(java.lang.Object rObject)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Stores the hierarchy of a single object in the database. That means that the object and all of it's children will be stored. This method will be invoked recursively (from Storage.store(Object)) for each level of child objects.
        Specified by:
        storeObject in class Storage
        Parameters:
        rObject - The object to store
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If storing the object fails
